title: Use Bracket Notation to Find the Last Character in a String
content: In order to get the last letter of a string, you can substract one from the strins's length.
For example, if const firstName = 'Ada', you can get the value of the last letter of the string by using firstName[firstName.length -1]
lastLetter would have a value of the string 'a'.

exercises.instruction: Use bracket notation to find the last character in the lastName variable.
placeholder: const lastLetterOfLastName = lastName; // Change this line
